intro: Pogonotrophe wightiana, commonly known as the Wight's beard-tongue, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
